--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0200 b) Date of Occurrence: 05/08/2023
c) Installation Details: Talon Swift - AC-2606-287 at
Regional Depot-C
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 11/08/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pressurization d) Main Assembly: Pylon-C
e) Nomenclature: Pressurization Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Upgraded
g) Part No.: PN-3441-W7 h) Sl No.: SN-5208-447
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 23/10/2020 l) Date of Removal: 10/08/2023
Pg No: 125 Ln No: 24 Pg No: 54 Ln No: 16
m) Manufacturing Agency: Epsilon Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year February 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 287 Hrs / 1573 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pressurization component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Replace entire assembly due to extent of damage
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement quality control check at manufacturing stage
d) Attributable Code: N2 - Defect Not Confirmed
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 08/09/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 10/09/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 11/09/2023 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid.
Date: 12/09/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable.
Date: 15/09/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
